thread.title: Delhi survive Haryana scare

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Delhi survive Haryana scare
text:
Anil Datt
Ludhiana, October 5
Last year’s runners-up Delhi (boys) survived a scare from Haryana before romping home victorious (98-81) on the fourth day of the 66th Junior National Basketball Championship. The Group B match got off to a brisk pace with Delhi establishing a lead (25-20) at the end of the opening quarter. The duo of Sunil Kumar and Vishal Gupta were in the thick of action. However, Haryana bounced back with vengeance through Sonu Kumar, who penetrated the rivals’ defence time and again. Delhi wilted under the pressure, allowing Haryana to take one-point lead at the end of the half-time (45-43). Delhi skipper Sunil Kumar made all the difference in the next two quarters to steer his side to victory. He sank in 33 points and was ably assisted by Vishal and Rachit Kumar, who contributed 21 and 14 points, respectively. For the losing team, Sonu Kumar was the main scorer with 19 points, while Lalit and Deepak chipped in with 13 points each. Meanwhile, defending champions Punjab boys continued to dominate the proceedings, facing no challenge so far. In a match played on Sunday evening, the local lads pipped Karnataka 83-34 to record their third win in a row. Basketball Jr Nationals Results Girls TN bt AP 48-10 Gujrat bt Chandigarh 69-54 Odisha bt U’khand (forfeit) Kerala bt Maha 94-73 J&K bt Telangana 38-17 HP bt Puducherry 52-31 (Sunday evening) Chhattisgarh bt Delhi 71-60 Telengana bt Tripura 31-9 Boys Maha bt MP 66-63 Raj bt Kanataka 76-53 Kerala bt AP 64-29 Delhi bt Hary 98-81 UP bt Gujarat 83-68 Chandigarh bt Chhattisgarh 66-51 WB bt J&K 70-45 (Sunday evening) Punjab bt Karnataka 83-34 Chhattisgarh bt HP 52-35 Odisha bt Gujrat 76-75 UP bt Goa 59-33
